div1.p: The president of the National Council of Teachers of English has requested me to secure a speaker to address the Council at a luncheon Saturday, November 30, in Kansas City, Missouri.

We shall also want this speaker to address that morning, a section of elementary school teachers of English. Of course, we shall want you to talk about your poetry. The section of elementary school teachers of English will be particualrly interested in your "Song of the Indian Wars", "Song of Hugh Glass", and "Song of Three Friends", because these are great favorites with boys in the upper grades.

Your topic at the luncheon before the entire Council can be whatever you wish to make it. Your experiences deliberately planned preliminary to the writing of "Hugh Glass" and the "Three Friends" would be of absorbing interest.

The Council will pay an honorarium of fifty dollars, which I hope will meet your expenses. I do not know your present address, but I have been told that it is in the Missouri section of the country. Please telegraph me collect, letting me know whether you can accept this invitation. I look forward with the greatest anticipation to your acceptance.
